column3: Commodore Reyner wishes to speak with you regarding the upcoming banquet.
The commodore has suggested that you speak with Baderon and acquire suitable attire for the banquet. Head to the Drowning Wench and see what the canny proprietor can provide for you.

It seems that your current garb lacks the refinement expected of a guest attending one of the Admiral's high-class banquets. Visit J'nasshym at the Octant, and pick up the <If(PlayerParameter(4))>“lady-like”<Else/>“gentlemanly”</If> addition to your apparel.
J'nasshym has entrusted you with a raxa-wrapped box containing your <If(PlayerParameter(4))>“lady-like”<Else/>“gentlemanly”</If> apparel. Return to the Drowning Wench and show the package to Baderon.

After handing the box over to Baderon, you discover that it holds a pair of expensive dress shoes. The Wench's proprietor explains that the footwear is a gift from him, and from all the people you have aided during your journeys. Speak with Baderon again once you are ready to attend the banquet.
Speak with Baderon at the Drowning Wench.
Receive a package from J'nasshym at the Octant.
Show the raxa-wrapped box to Baderon.
You must understand how unusual it is for the Admiral to invite an adventurer to one of her banquets!
It is a highly coveted honor. Why, even the officers under her direct command are rarely afforded such recognition!
Many of the tasks you have performed have been difficult as well as dangerous.
But finally your efforts are to be rewarded─a nod towards your triumphs, both large and small.

Has the enormity of this moment yet to sink in? Perhaps you will realize its significance when you stand before Limsa Lominsa's assembled dignitaries...and now that I've imagined the scene, I realize that you shall require attire suitable for the occasion.
Why don't you visit the Wench and see what Baderon can arrange? He is surprisingly knowledgeable about such things.
Merlwyb invited ye to one of 'er fancy feasts, now did she?
I tell ye, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lass<Else/>lad</If>, I damn near snorted ale out me nose when I heard the news. Ye've come a long way, and that's the gods' 'onest truth.
Ye'll not be disappointed by the grub─the Admiral sets 'er table with dishes from the bleedin' Bismarck, no less.
'Tis a grand chance to fill yer belly to burstin' with fine and─more importantly─free food.
But we can't have ye showin' up in yer grimy ol' 'venturin' kit.

No, the 'ero o' the day needs to 'ave a touch o' refinement while <If(PlayerParameter(4))>she's<Else/>'e's</If> nibblin' on lemon cupcakes. Ye take yerself over to the Octant and speak with J'nasshym o' the Brugaire Consortium. She'll sort ye out with some <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lady-like<Else/>gentlemanly</If> apparel.
I've already 'ad a word with 'er, so all ye need do is pick up the goods then come back 'ere to the Wench.

Good <If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),12))><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),4))>evening<Else/>morning</If><Else/><If(LessThan(PlayerParameter(11),17))>day<Else/>evening</If></If>, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>miss<Else/>sir</If>. I assume you're the underdressed <If(PlayerParameter(4))>“lady”<Else/>“gentleman”</If> Baderon mentioned?
<sniff> Well, I can certainly improve on the─ahem─style you're currently sporting.
I've chosen these especially for your debut into priviliged society. Fear not, I'm certain you shall absolutely <Emphasis>adore</Emphasis> them.
Ye've been to see J'nasshym, then? Let's 'ave that box.
'Ere we go. A right <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lovely<Else/>smart</If> pair o' dress shoes for ye.

A <If(PlayerParameter(4))>lass<Else/>bloke</If> mightn't 'ave much else to <If(PlayerParameter(4))>'er<Else/>'is</If> name, but as long as ye take care o' yer feet, ye can keep walkin' towards yer goals.
Think of 'em as a gift from me, and from all the other folk what ye've 'elped on yer way.
Now ye've sorted yer garb, ye just need to settle yer nerves. Let me know when yer ready and I'll give ye directions to the banquet.
